heading: Laugh II Totem
lines: A sibling to the original Laugh relic, this version doubles down on looping smiles.
Follow the staggered plates that vibrate like stacked bells when you orbit around.
Look for the cheeky slice removed from its core to keep the mass feeling weightless.
Even the shadows wobble, giving the whole sculpture a cartoon heartbeat.

heading: Loud Card Relic
lines: Collectible-card proportions get frozen into a beveled monolith here.
Count the foil ridges and neon insets that suggest a prized pull from a booster pack.
Surface etchings hint at sigils and team crests if you stare long enough.
It balances between glossy showroom energy and alley-found grit.

heading: Laugh Archive
lines: This archival capture keeps the original grin intact inside crystalline shells.
Negative space slices let air whistle through like organ pipes.
Chromed seams map out the joke you almost remember hearing.
Consider it a reliquary for echoes of inside jokes across the city.

heading: Bob The Mascot
lines: Bob’s grin holds the whole presentation together even in solo mode.
Gangly limbs stretch like inflatables tethered to impossible joints.
A graffiti-inspired palette keeps him grounded in Rotterdam streets.
Search for the hidden tags scratched into his armor plating.

heading: Feyenoord Pulse
lines: Stadium roars get squashed into chiseled channels down the torso.
Alternating red-and-white panes nod toward jerseys and banners.
Vents along the spine act like sirens frozen mid-blast.
Imagine the whole relic humming when a match kicks off.

heading: Erasmus Beacon
lines: A calm guardian that stacks marble slabs into a soft leaning tower.
Micro facets split light like river reflections under the Erasmus Bridge.
Armor plates fold like book pages, a nod to Erasmus’ manuscripts.
Stay long enough and you’ll spot the subtle halo drifting upward.

heading: Matchasurf Rider
lines: Surfer silhouettes hide between the layered petals of this totem.
Matcha hues fade into vapor trails swirling around the crown.
Translucent fins read like waves caught mid-break on the Maas.
It smells like rooftop tea breaks and salt carried inland.

heading: Trashdude Guardian
lines: Bottle caps, stickers, and bent tin collide into a hulking protector.
Every dent and fold is left untouched to honor the salvage origins.
Resin seams glow faintly, welding scraps into a single champion.
Trashdude keeps alleys weird, safe, and decidedly awake.

heading: Pigeon Lady Idol
lines: An ode to the caretakers who coax pigeons onto their shoulders downtown.
Feather motifs and copper mirrors flutter around the statuette.
A gentle lean and cane keep the stance welcoming, not imposing.
Look closely to find tiny birds tucked between the crown’s arches.

heading: Spiderdude Sentinel
lines: Angular limbs weave scaffolding that looks mid-parkour leap.
Thread-like struts stretch between ribs like spun webbing.
Glass shells catch stray city neons and flicker them back.
He’s frozen in mid-swing, waiting for you to call him back to action.

heading: WIP Prototype
lines: Construction lines are still visible to prove this relic is in flux.
Placeholder colors map lighting passes that have yet to be baked.
Whole sections are ghosted out so you can peer into the process.
Consider it a teaser for the next drop of Rotterdam totems.
